subject: Re: Web issues on Safari
preview: Thanks Joel! And thanks for looking into it for us, as perhaps Robert's updated just didn't save.  He managed to send the email out and has directed people to the Eventbrite page in the mean-time :)

full_threads.body:
Thanks Joel! And thanks for looking into it for us, as perhaps Robert's updated just didn't save.

He managed to send the email out and has directed people to the Eventbrite page in the mean-time :)

Una Mapes

Marketing Director



Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd

+44 7378 526062 | una@veldhoencompany.com

London | http://www.veldhoencompany.com/

Follow us on

Hi Una, 

Regarding the Case study issue showing an English version when you click the Load more. Its a "cookie" incompatibility not passing the current language (this only occurs when you are not logged in), so we have adjusted some of the scripts to work with the it. Hope that make sense. 

Regarding Roberts stuff, no we did not reverted back to an old version. But there seems to be a trail of changes made on the page (please see the attached image), we could restore a version using this list by clicking on the date and clicking the "restore this revision". Let me know if you need help? Cheers!

Hi Guys

Robert in NL was just about to send an email to their contacts about the event they're planning... and the page has reverted to an old version, and no longer live.

Did something happen when you were working on the site yesterday? There was a lot of work put into creating the page

It also looks like some amends I did to the NL site are no longer there too - which is why I think something happened for the site to go back to an old version...

Let us know if you can help us get Robert's work back asap!

The page is in News > Events> Dutch Seminar

Thanks!!

Una Mapes

Marketing Director



Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd

+44 7378 526062 | una@veldhoencompany.com

London | http://www.veldhoencompany.com/

Follow us on

Thanks Joel! Why was it like that?

Cheers

Una

Una Mapes

Hi Una,

Confirming that the casestudy page filters are now fixed. Cheers!

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body: @joel can you please investigate this one?

Hi Heath

Attached are screen grabs of the dutch case study site, when viewed in Google Chrome.
However when I look at the same page on Safari I don’t see half these case studies, but I see lots of errors...



Or featured images that don’t fit the space...



I’ve cleared the cache... would you know why this is?

Also, the same for the Japanese site.. . on Google Chrome the case studies are featured (as duplicates) but on Safari the page is blank.
Do I have a bug in my mac?

Cheers
Una

That’s great Kim – good to post about our case studies and any of our content! ☺
Would love to learn from you after your Instagram course, please do look at the Instagram account. As we have it but need to use it more effectively!

Also re case studies on the site, I was hoping you could update the layouts, or make the pages a bit more interesting and source better imagery for some.
I know this might be better when we have the brand guidelines, so just want to get it on your radar that there are still a few fixes that need to happen here.

Example:
these case studies (and the ones that follow) aren’t in the latest case study online layout. May not all need that treatment – would be good to go through and work that out.



They also have old, out-of-date shots as the featured images...(can’t see the person in the middle)



Or featured images that don’t fit the space...




These will all need your help! ☺
I know Sheila was working on creating summaries of the case studies for NL - which would help hugely!
Might be worthwhile asking Roel where that’s saved and we can chat about it on Tuesday!

Cheers
Una
